question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Persepolis"?
explanation: Iran houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Persepolis". Persepolis was the ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire (c. 550â€“330 BC). It is situated in the plains of Marvdasht, encircled by southern Zagros mountains. The earliest remains of Persepolis date back to 515 BC. It exemplifies the Achaemenid style of architecture. UNESCO declared the ruins of Persepolis a World Heritage Site in 1979.
